newsitem.title: UK: Sterling steady in light, late European trade.
newsitem.headline: Sterling steady in light, late European trade.

text.p: Sterling was steady in afternoon Europe, but down from earlier highs against the mark and dollar as trading geared down for the UK and U.S. holiday weekend.
Traders said dealing was relatively quiet and position-squaring on the pound's tumble over the last two days took it higher from morning lows.
But with no UK data today and the holiday weekend afoot, technical factors took over.

"It still looked pretty bearish this morning but it held around 2.7420 marks, a significant chart level," said a German bank dealer. "But the bounce has been held at another chart point around 2.7650."
By afternoon trade, sterling/mark traded at 2.7547/57, up from early lows of 2.7422 but still shy of late Thursday's 2.7670/80 marks.
Sterling/dollar was also firmer at $1.6286/98, also up from earlier lows but still down from $1.6337/47 Thursday.
Recent concerns in the market that Bank of England Governor Eddie George may not be re-appointed at the end of his five-year
